meanings.definition: To cause someone to adopt radical positions or beliefs.
meanings.sent1: The group's extreme views were radicalizing some members.
meanings.sent2: She was radicalizing her friends with her strong opinions.
meanings.sent3: The idea of only eating pizza every day was radicalizing.
meanings.sent4: His passionate speeches were radicalizing the audience.
meanings.sent5: The intense music had a radicalizing effect on the crowd.

meanings.sent1: The radicalizing of the individual happened gradually.
meanings.sent2: She observed the radicalizing of her classmates with concern.
meanings.sent3: The sudden interest in extreme sports was a radicalizing experience.
meanings.sent4: The radicalizing of the organization led to significant changes.
meanings.sent5: The radicalizing of the community was evident in their protests.
